description: Two low-stakes quizzes (6% each) and one comprehensive end-of-term quiz (18%) testing understanding of lecture content through multiple-choice and short answer formats. Includes feedback sessions to address learning gaps.

Group presentation of a draft threatened species management plan to simulated stakeholders. Includes role-specific contributions, population viability analysis outputs, and Q&A session. Graded on group (15%) and individual (15%) performance.

Individual report compiling a species management plan with context analysis, population viability results, and intervention assessment. Builds on formative activities and limited to 3000 words. Permits AI-assisted planning with significant original input.

Individual reflection comparing initial grant proposal responses with final management plan to demonstrate learning evolution in conservation practice. Requires articulation of personal growth in conservation understanding.
